list.content: We are gathered here today to celebrate the life of my coffee maker, which is one of the two that died within the last two months. Now you can make coffee for Einstein and Segovia among the clouds.

style.backgroundImage: repeating-linear-gradient(45deg, transparent, transparent 35px, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1) 35px, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1) 70px), repeating-linear-gradient(-45deg, transparent, transparent 35px, rgba(255,255,255,0.2) 35px, rgba(255,255,255,0.2) 70px), linear-gradient(black, #363636)

list.content: Pain may be the price we pay for having love in our lives.
list.notes: This one is inspired by a conversation in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vTVQtsIfoo8

list.content: I sometimes imagine myself traveling to the past to tell people about what today's world is like. I try to imagine how they would perceive what the world has become.
How much bad should be allowed for the greater good?
list.notes: This quote is taken from a Wendover Productions video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9dnN82DsQ2k

list.content: Why do land animals have bladders? I can't really tell what kind of an evolutionary advantage being able to hold your bladder offers.
Gummy bears are my favorite candy

We have poetry, theater, books, movies, all kinds of art, and all genres of music; we developed AR and VR, built all kinds of immersive games and experiences on top of them. But despite all of these amazing ways of communication, we cannot even start to understand how someone else sees the world unless we have been in their shoes.
So much changes in so little time while it feels like nothing changes overall.
People don't like Matrix sequels, but I disagree. They have some amazing moments and they do an amazing job of turning the trope of "hero's journey" on its head.
So many expect someone else to love them before they love themselves.
If you have to choose between bird-man and man-bird, always choose bird-man.
Pencils used to be a regular part of my life. Now it's incredibly rare that I use one for anything other than signing my name.
Turns out, not everyone wants to be able to fly...
I wholeheartedly want James Webb Space Telescope to successfully deploy and show us all the amazing things we cannot yet see
